intro: Stenogyne calaminthoides var. oxyodonta, commonly known as the Hawaiian stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is a rare and endangered species, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
